title: Racist rhetoric by Tunisian president sparks fear among migrants and Black Tunisians
description: Tunisian President Kais Saied says that migration by sub-Saharan Africans is part of a demographic conspiracy, a theory rights groups have condemned as racist.

title: 1st transgender woman to compete in Puerto Rico pageant
description: A transgender woman has for the first time been selected to participate in the Puerto Rico Miss Universe contest held in the largely conservative U.S. territory

title: Prada, Max Mara promote modesty and utility on Milan runways
description: Milan designers took a more modest turn on the second day of Milan Fashion Week of mostly womenswear looks for next fall and winter

title: London activists paint Ukraine’s flag in front of Russian Embassy
description: The stunt reflects continued high support for Ukraine in Britain, even as it begins to falter elsewhere.

title: UN to vote on resolution calling for Russia to leave Ukraine
description: Ukraine’s supporters urged the U.N. General Assembly to vote for a resolution that calls for Russia to end hostilities and withdraw from its neighbor on the eve of the first anniversary of Moscow’s invasion

title: Anti-logging activist killed in western Mexico
description: Authorities in western Mexico are investigating the killing of an indigenous anti-logging activist, the latest in a round of murders and disappearances

title: Italian court acquits most over 29 avalanche deaths in hotel
description: Italian media say a court has acquitted 25 of the 30 defendants on trial for a deadly avalanche at an Apennine mountain hotel

title: Mexico president foresees court challenges to electoral law
description: Mexico’s president says he expects court challenges to a new law that will cut funding for the country’s electoral agency and weaken oversight of campaign spending

title: Indian opposition party spokesman arrested for mocking Modi
description: The arrest of the Congress party's Pawan Khera after his remarks insulting Modi follows an investigation of BBC offices for a documentary also criticized by the prime minister's supporters.

title: Ukraine installs shock-proof glass to protect Banksy war art
description: The paintings will also be protected by additional wireless security systems, ensuring that any reports of theft or damage can be quickly handled.

title: German court convicts man over deadly 2014 attack in Syria
description: A German court has convicted a Palestinian man from Syria of a war crime and murder for launching a grenade into a crowd of civilians waiting for food in Damascus in 2014

title: Britain is running out of salad. Let us explain.
description: "SEIZE HER SALAD," one tabloid said, as supermarkets ration tomatoes. Britain already faces record inflation and a cost-of-living crisis.

title: Pregnant Russians flock to Argentina seeking new passports
description: Over the past year, Argentine immigration authorities have noticed flights packed with dozens of pregnant Russians

title: Stockholm police head found dead after report criticized him
description: A senior Swedish police officer has been found dead in his home, hours after the release of an internal report that found a conflict of interest regarding decisions he made about a former employee with whom he had a relationship

title: 1st baby pangolin in Europe born in Prague zoo, doing well
description: A Chinese pangolin has been born in the Prague zoo, the first birth of the critically endangered animal in Europe

title: While Ukrainians train on Leopard tanks, West is still short on pledges
description: German officials say they are still struggling to get countries to help fulfill a promise of two tank battalions for Ukraine by the end of March.

title: 80,000 items from rock legend David Bowie to go on display in London
description: Thousands of items belonging to the musical legend will go on display at London's V&A museum starting in 2025 to celebrate the life of the late cultural icon.

title: Yellen at G-20 says oil price cap is working and denting Russian revenue
description: The treasury secretary pledged to increase economic assistance to Ukraine by $10 billion at the G-20 in India.

title: Israel: Oman to allow Israeli planes through its airspace
description: Israel’s foreign minister says the Gulf Arab state of Oman has decided to allow Israeli planes to fly through its airspace

title: Papua New Guinea kidnappers free woman, still hold 4 others
description: Police say kidnappers have released a woman who was held for several days in a remote part of Papua New Guinea and security forces are continuing to negotiate for the freedom of four other hostages

title: Eurojust to support probes into aggression in Ukraine war
description: The European Union’s judicial cooperation agency is setting up a new center to support efforts to gather evidence of the crime of aggression in Ukraine

title: Separated by war, a Ukrainian family balances safety, duty and love
description: He is on the front line. She is adjusting to life in Germany. The Ukraine war anniversary marks nearly a year living apart.

title: Iconic West African leader Sankara reburied in Burkina Faso
description: Burkina Faso’s revolutionary leader, Thomas Sankara, has been reburied, eight years after his body was exhumed as part of an investigation

title: Pope cancels an appointment, some speeches due to bad cold
description: Pope Francis has cancelled an audience with an Italian YMCA group and skipped speeches due to a bad cold

title: UK ruling delivers rare victory for Beirut blast victims
description: A British court has ruled a London-based company that delivered the explosive ammonium nitrate to Beirut’s port is liable towards the victims of a devastating 2020 blast, according to Lebanon’s Beirut Bar Association

title: European Commission bans TikTok from staff phones over security fears
description: The decision follows similar moves in the United States amid a growing confrontation between China, home to TikTok's parent firm, and the West.

title: Bloodied Wagner fighters captured in Ukraine recount path from prison to war
description: In an interview, fighters from the Russian mercenary group said they were recruited from jail, sent to fight in Ukraine and shown violent videos of alleged traitors being executed.

title: Death toll from Turkey, Syria earthquake tops 47,000
description: Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu has raised the number of fatalities in Turkey from the magnitude 7.8 earthquake to 43,556

title: Danish queen recovering from 'extensive' back surgery
description: Denmark’s royal household says Queen Margrethe II, whose half-century reign makes her Europe’s longest-serving monarch, has undergone “extensive back surgery” and the condition of the monarch “is good and stable under the circumstances.”

title: Ukraine shuns OSCE gathering in Vienna over Russian presence
description: A meeting of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe’s parliamentary assembly has got underway with Ukraine’s delegation, which is boycotting the event

title: Iran acknowledges accusation it enriched uranium to 84%
description: Iran is directly acknowledging an accusation attributed to international inspectors that it enriched uranium to 84% purity for the first time, which would put the Islamic Republic closer than ever to weapons-grade material

title: Ahmed Qureia, top Palestinian negotiator with Israel, dies
description: Ahmed Qureia, a former Palestinian prime minister and one of the architects of interim peace deals with Israel, has died at age 85

title: Afghanistahn's Taliban reopen key trade route with Pakistan
description: Officials say Afghanistan’s ruling Taliban have reopened the key Torkham border crossing with Pakistan after keeping it shut for four days

title: Abu Dhabi state gas firm looks to raise $2B in IPO
description: Abu Dhabi’s state gas company expects to raise up to $2 billion by selling 4% of its shares in an initial public offering

title: Bird flu kills 11-year-old girl in Cambodia, officials say
description: An 11-year-old girl in Cambodia has died from bird flu in the country’s first known human H5N1 infection since 2014

title: South Sudan's president calls on refugees to return home
description: South Sudan’s president has urged the country’s more than 2 million refugees to return home in his first meeting with displaced people since civil war erupted almost a decade ago

title: IS attacks on Syria truffle hunters are deadliest in a year
description: In recent days, the Islamic State group has carried out its deadliest attacks in more than year, killing dozens of civilians and security officers in the deserts of central Syria

title: Ukraine live briefing: U.N. to vote on resolution calling for Russia to leave Ukraine
description: Ukraine's foreign minister urged the world to show solidarity in the U.N. vote, as President Biden promised to defend "literally every inch of NATO."

title: In Nigeria’s election, young people seek to wield new power
description: Peter Obi's promises of reform have won a wide following among young people, who represent 70 percent of the population.

title: Gaza rockets, Israeli strikes follow deadly West Bank raid
description: Palestinian militants in Gaza have launched rockets at southern Israel and Israeli aircraft have struck targets in the coastal enclave

title: The practice of revoking citizenship was tainted. Not anymore.
description: The case of Shamima Begum is part of a broader global trend toward a policy once tainted by Nazi Germany.
